instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
Arrived not turning on from minor liquid damage on trackpad itself. Replaced with known good trackpad and cable. Keyboard works and trackpad clicks but does not track. Board itself has no liquid damage.

What to check first? Can bad <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> cause this

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
Do you get both voltages for J5700?
Check all traces between J5700 and <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
Try another trackpad cable, many chinese cables are crap...

With patience, you can check all the connection between <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and the pins of the connector in the trackpad board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
yes both voltages are at J5700

Traces are fine.. no damage of any sort on the board.

continuity between J5700 and cpnnector on trackpad board are good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
Try another trackpad board too.
You can also change <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, just in case...
